pullRequest.body:
adds `SimpleGraph.odd_components_card_mono` and `SimpleGraph.odd_components_card_deleteVerts_mono` along with supporting lemma's.

Uses `Nat.card` rather than `Set.ncard` to be consistent with [this occurrance](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/df255e235cde3ac9e4325de51cfa2bc82b7b2416/Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Matching.lean#L267)

In preparation for Tutte's theorem.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

[Zulip thread on Tutte's theorem](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Tutte's.20theorem)

[Example usage of this result in the proof of Tutte's](https://github.com/pimotte/TutteLean/blob/78a744a0f5e244ca56879871e7f4ab956e1ccebd/TutteLean.lean#L210)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [de13820838](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20398/commits/de13820838feea7a11cbc9a7c5da7baacb799b66)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity.WalkCounting | 711 | 713 | +2 (+0.28%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.StronglyRegular` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity.WalkCounting` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.AdjMatrix`</details>|2|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_of_common_vertex`
`+ instDecidableRel_deleteVerts_adj`
`+ ncard_odd_components_mono`
`+ nonempty_supp`
`+ odd_components_card_deleteVerts_mono`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
    [DecidableRel G.Adj] (h : G ≤ G') :
     ({c : ConnectedComponent G' | Odd (Nat.card c.supp)}).ncard
      ≤ ({c : ConnectedComponent G | Odd (Nat.card c.supp)}).ncard := by
```
for readability

That's a rather odd proof layout. What about
```suggestion
  have aux (c : G'.ConnectedComponent) (hc : Odd (Nat.card c.supp)) :
      {c' : G.ConnectedComponent | c'.supp ⊆ c.supp ∧ Odd (Nat.card c'.supp)}.Nonempty := by
    refine Set.nonempty_of_ncard_ne_zero fun h' ↦ ?_
    simpa [h'] using (c.odd_card_supp_iff_odd_subcomponents _ h).mp hc
```
This was kind of what I was looking for, but I didn't arrive at the refine with the inline lambda to make it clean, thanks!

```suggestion
  refine Finite.card_le_of_injective f fun c c' fcc' ↦ ?_
  simp only [Subtype.mk.injEq, f] at fcc'
  exact Subtype.val_injective (ConnectedComponent.eq_of_common_vertex
    ((fcc' ▸ (aux c.1 c.2).choose_spec.1) (ConnectedComponent.nonempty_supp _).some_mem)
      ((aux c'.1 c'.2).choose_spec.1 (ConnectedComponent.nonempty_supp _).some_mem))
```

```suggestion
lemma natCard_odd_components_deleteVerts_mono [Fintype V] [DecidableEq V] (G G' : SimpleGraph V)
```
Similarly here, can you avoid starting the statement on the previous line if you are gonna need a linebreak?

```suggestion
lemma eq_of_common_vertex {v : V} {c c' : ConnectedComponent G} (hc : v ∈ c.supp)
```

```suggestion
  cases' r x y with hl hr
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): add monotonicity of number of odd components
